value.title: DAX Fridays! #131: Create a custom relative date filter in Power BI

value.title: DAX Fridays! #166: Compare spread after the first 100 cases | Recreating the Financial Times Graph
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to recreate the financial times graph in power bi where they compare the spread of confirmed cases after the countries hit their first 100 cases.  We will do the calculation using DAX and will plot the graph in Power BI.  Link to FT article: https://www.ft.com/content/a26fbf7e-48f8-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441

value.title: DAX Fridays! #184: Show last label only on a line chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Displaying only the last label on a line chart is quite a common scenario that is not supported in Power BI by default, so in today's vide I am going to show you how to do that with a little bit of DAX magic!  And sorry I forgot the link to the blog: https://datastud.dev/pages/projects  Here you can

value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX!  The DIVIDE function performs divisions and returns alternate result or BLANK() on division by 0.It is faster than the simple division operator.  NEXT VIDEO: - PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SsZseKOgrWQ   Looking for a download file?

value.title: DAX Fridays! #: 75: SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the DAX function called SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR.  This little function is great for analyzing as the function itself says, the same period last year.  If you have seasonal business and you want to analyze what happended the same period the previous year, it will do it flowless.
